Name: treatment of wastewater from cathode ray tube production, wastewater treatment | wastewater from cathode ray tube production | EN15804GD, U
Category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/37:Sewerage/370:Sewerage/3700:Sewerage
Description: This activity represents the treatment of a specific wastewater in a WWT plant (while direct emissions and sewering are heeded in the upstream market dataset for this wastewater). The size of the treatment plant infrastructure is for a national average territory situation. The assumed size of the WWTP treats 90.6 Mio m3 per year. The mixture of WWTP with one, two, or three stages is 0%-11.2%-88.8%. The actual, waste-specific oxygen requirement in the biological stages is 0.1625kg O. The generated waste-specific raw sludge mass (dry matter) is 0.2453kg DM. 89% of the raw sludge (DM) is treated with anaerobic digestion. The digestion process produces 156.6 litres of biogas with an energy content of 3.625MJ. 23.6% of the biogas is utilized for energy. The remainder is flared. The gross electric efficiency is 26.564%. The gross thermal efficiency is 47.853%. After digestion, the remaining total sludge mass (dry matter) is 0.1288kg DM.
